content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-191-05-A
|Item_parent=Fever in an immunocompromised patient
|Item_parent_short=Fever in an immunocompromised patient
|Rank=A
|Intitle=Cite the three main routes of entry for fever in neutropenic patients
|Description=Digestive tract, skin (KT), lung
|Topic=Physiopathology
|Contributors=Amélie Servettaz
|Order=5}}

<big>The main infectious entry points are:</big>

<big>- '''Respiratory'''</big>

<big>- '''Digestive tract''' (mouth to anus)</big>

<big>- '''Skin favored by venous outlets'' (peripheral and central venous catheter)</big>

properties.question: What are the three main routes of entry for fever in neutropenic patients?
properties.option_a: Respiratory, Urinary, Skin favored by venous outlets
properties.option_b: Respiratory, Digestive tract, Skin favored by venous outlets
properties.option_c: Respiratory, Skin favored by lymphatic outlets, Central nervous system
properties.option_d: Respiratory, Digestive tract, Skin favored by venous outlets
